sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy vows to protect UN inspectors trying to reach the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The EU energy crisis deepens as Russia shuts off the Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline, citing maintenance.

sentences.sentence: And tributes pour in for Mikhail Gorbachev, the last leader of the Soviet Union, who's died at the age of 91.

sentences.sentence: Ukraine continues its offensive against Russia's forces across southern Ukraine,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukraine continues its offensive against Russia's forces across southern Ukraine, pushing the front line back some distance in places, according to British intelligence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces began striking Russian pontoon ferries across the Dnipro River from the 29th of August. Specifically, Ukrainian and Russian sources reported that Ukrainian forces struck a pontoon crossing constructed out of barges near the Antonievsky road bridge. Russian forces are continuing to transfer large convoys of military equipment from Crimea and also from Melitopol. The Institute for the Study of War says the Ukrainian counter-offensive is a cohesive process that will require some time to correctly execute. The Kremlin will likely exploit the lack of immediate victory over Kherson city or Ukrainian operational silence on the progress of the counter-offensive to misrepresent Ukrainian efforts as failing and to undermine public confidence. The think tank gives an update on Russian mobilization saying the deployment of some volunteer battalions within one week of their formation supports the assessment that they are severely understrength and poorly trained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.sentence: The European Union is stepping up initiatives to limit its dependence on Russian gas. Seven Baltic Sea nations have announced their commitment to a seven-fold increase in wind

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: power production to 20 gigawatts by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Enough to supply electricity to 20 million households.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Putin's attempt to blackmail us with fossil fuels is failing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We are accelerating the green transition, we are getting rid of the dependency of Russian fossil fuels and we are accelerating the renewable, clean, cheaper and homegrown renewable energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Brussels is also working to reform the electricity market to stop the cost of natural gas, determining electricity prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Other European nations are also pushing for new energy solutions, including Spain, where Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez wants to create a gas pipeline linking the Iberian Peninsula to central Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.sentence: I want to again underline that I very much support creating such a connection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's also about using hydrogen together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Brussels is calling on member states to cut energy usage by 15 percent, as over the last several months Russia's state energy giant Gazprom has cut off or reduced its supplies to a dozen EU countries, most recently France, where an energy sobriety plan is being set up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We must consume less energy at home, in transport, in shops, in businesses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Energy prices across Europe have soared due to the war in Ukraine, with gas costing almost 12 times more now than the start of 2021 discussions are ongoing within the eu to find a european approach to energy pricing mechanisms a one-of-a-kind statesman who changed the course of history. Tributes to the last leader of the Soviet Union, Mikhail Gorbachev, have been pouring

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in from around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A controversial leader at home resided over the breakup of the Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Gorbachev was widely hailed abroad for ushering an end to the Cold War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In a statement, Russian President Vladimir Putin praised his efforts to lead the country during a period of complex, dramatic changes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Yet Putin and Gorbachev had a frosty relationship in recent years, and the Kremlin added that he was wrong about having closer ties with the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Western leaders expressed their grief, gripped by a symbol who represented better relations with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Mikhail Gorbachev sent a wind of freedom into Russian society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He tried to change the communist system from inside, which became impossible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And he started the need of cooperation with the West stopping the Cold War and happily the hopes has vanished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it's this hope, this sense of what could have been, which led German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to lament Gorbachev's death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We know that he died at a time when not only democracy has failed in Russia, there is no other way to describe the current situation there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But also Russia and Russian President Putin are drawing new trenches in Europe and have started a horrible war against a neighbouring country, Ukraine. Ultimately ending the Cold War will be his defining international legacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The White House has credited Gorbachev with creating a safer world and greater freedom for millions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: China has expressed its condolences to his family, noting how he helped to improve relations between Moscow and Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: between Moscow and Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Wednesday marks 25 years since Princess Diana was killed in a car crash in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Her death thrust not only the British royal family but the world into shock and mourning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The then 36-year-old was known for her advocacy for AIDS patients and landmine removal in developing countries. The crash raised scrutiny over the tabloid press coverage of her as well as conspiracy theories around the circumstances of her death. Russia's state-owned energy firm has stopped the flow of natural gas through a major pipeline from Russia to Europe. Gazprom has announced three-day maintenance on the Nord Stream 1 amid concerns of a potential energy crisis on the continent this winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Germany, where Russia accounts for about a third of its gas supplies, has accused Moscow of weaponizing energy.
